title: Lake Mead National Recreation Area: Liberty Bell Arch
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Atlas of Lake Mead     Liberty Bell Arch                Liberty Bell Arch          Liberty Bell Arch is located in a very accessible region of the park. It is so named for it's resemblance to the famous Liberty Bell, at Independence National Historic Park in Pennsylvania. It even includes the "clapper", or the round part of the bell that causes it to ring. Over millions of years nature formed this geologic structure that is more commonly found in Arches National Monument. Over geologic time erosion through wind and water created this unusual arch formation.     Area Map            Back to Top      How Arches are Made  Arches are created through a process spanning over millions of years. The Following video shows the 300 million years of change that created arches, like the Liberty Bell Arch.                        Geologic Creation of an Arch Short video on the creation of geologic arches.  Duration:3 minutes, 32 seconds              Photo Gallery                    Liberty Bell Arch Photos   4 Photos  Photos of the Liberty Bell Arch and surrounding area.                       Back to Top
